en: Moreover Jehovah answered Job, and said,
hmr: Chu naw khawm chu LALPA chun Job chu a dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: Shall he that cavilleth contend with the Almighty? He that argueth with God, let him answer it.
hmr: “Iengkimthawthei kaltu chun ama ân chûktir ding am a nih? Pathien sêlkaltu chun dawn raw se,” tiin.

en: Then Job answered Jehovah, and said,
hmr: Chun, Job chun LALPA chu a dawn a, a hril tah a,

en: Behold, I am of small account; what shall I answer thee? I lay my hand upon my mouth.
hmr: “Ngai ta, kei iengkhawplo hin ieng tin am dawn ka ti che a? Ka kutin ka bau hup el ka tih.

en: Once have I spoken, and I will not answer; Yea, twice, but I will proceed no further.
hmr: Vawi khat thu ka hril tah a, dawn chu dawn naw ning; Anih, vawi hni, amiruokchu, hril pei naw ning,” tiin.

en: Then Jehovah answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Job chu thlivira chun a hung dawn a, a hril tah a,

en: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
hmr: “Pasal angin tuhin i dier kei la, Nang chu indawn ka ti che a, mi hril rawh;

en: Wilt thou even annul my judgment? Wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be justified?
hmr: Nang ngei khawma ka rorêl hi i ngaitha ding am a nih? Thiem i chang theina dingin, kei chu thiemnaw i mîn changtir ding maw?

en: Or hast thou an arm like God? And canst thou thunder with a voice like him?
hmr: Annawleh, Pathien angin bân i nei am a nih? Ama ang chun râwlriin i sukrûm thei am a nih?

en: Deck thyself now with excellency and dignity; And array thyself with honor and majesty.
hmr: Tuhin ṭha famkimna le insângnain inbel la, Ropuina le inzâumnain inthuom bawk rawh.

en: Pour forth the overflowings of thine anger; And look upon every one that is proud, and abase him.
hmr: I lunginsen sip liemhai chu bunthla la, Mi a chapo taphawt chu en la, ngaihnuoi la,

en: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; And tread down the wicked where they stand.
hmr: Mi a chapo taphawt chu en la, siehnuoi rawh; Chun, mi rilo chu an ngîrnaa chun sir thlu rawh.

en: Hide them in the dust together; Bind their faces in the hidden place.
hmr: Pilvuta chun anni chu thup tâwl la, An hmaihai chu hmun inthupa chun inkhum rawh.

en: Then will I also confess of thee That thine own right hand can save thee.
hmr: Chun, kei khawma i kut changtieng chun Nangma a sandam thei che a nih ti hrieng ka tih.

en: Behold now, behemoth, which I made as well as thee; He eateth grass as an ox.
hmr: “Ngai ta, tuhin tuisamak nanga anga ka siem chun, Sebâwngchal angin hlobet a fâk a nih.

en: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, And his force is in the muscles of his belly.
hmr: Ngai ta, tuhin a hrâtna chu a kâwngahai chun a um a, A tha chu a phing tisaahai chun a um a nih.

en: He moveth his tail like a cedar: The sinews of his thighs are knit together.
hmr: Sidar thing angin a mei chu a hêm a, A êlpui thahruihai chu ân têl khâwm a nih.

en: His bones are as tubes of brass; His limbs are like bars of iron.
hmr: A ruhai chu dârsen theikhuonghai ang a na, A kut le kehai chu thîr tluonhai ang an nih.

en: He is the chief of the ways of God: He only that made him giveth him his sword.
hmr: Pathien siemhaia lal chu a na, Ama siemtu chau chun a thal chu ama kuomah a pêk thei a.

en: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, Where all the beasts of the field do play.
hmr: Matheiloin, tlânghai chun bu an hung insuopêk a, Ramsahai po po inhnelna hmun ngeihai chun.

en: He lieth under the lotus-trees, In the covert of the reed, and the fen.
hmr: Tuihna buk hnuoiahai chun a zâl a, Phairuong buk hnuoi dûma chun.

en: The lotus-trees cover him with their shade; The willows of the brook compass him about.
hmr: Tuihna kûnghai chun an hlimin an inkhum a, Vadungte phahrâmhai chun ama a tuom bawk a.

en: Behold, if a river overflow, he trembleth not; He is confident, though a Jordan swell even to his mouth.
hmr: Ngai ta, vadung chu hung lien sien khawm, ân thin ngai nawh a. Jordan chu a bau chenin hung lien sien khawm ân ringzo a nih.

en: Shall any take him when he is on the watch, Or pierce through his nose with a snare?
hmr: Ân vêng zing lai chun miin an lâk ding am a nih? Annawleh, a hnâr dâwn chu chângin an âwk ding am a nih?
